title: Crew Arrives at Kennedy Space Center
description: The crew of the Space Shuttle Challenger arrives at Kennedy Space Center in preparation for the launch scheduled the following day.

title: First Attempt at Launch
description: The first launch attempt is scrubbed due to bad weather at a transatlantic abort landing site.

title: Ice Check Performed
description: Due to unusually cold temperatures overnight, an ice inspection is performed and icicles over 200mm in length are observed on the pad structure.

title: Ice Concerns Dismissed
description: Concerns about ice on the pad are dismissed, and the countdown continues.

title: Challenger Lifts Off
description: The Space Shuttle Challenger lifts off from Kennedy Space Center.

title: Booster Rocket Failure
description: The right solid rocket booster fails, leading to the disintegration of the orbiter.

title: Orbiter Breaks Apart
description: The orbiter breaks apart due to aerodynamic forces.

title: Public Learns of Disaster
description: News of the disaster starts to spread across the globe.

title: President Reagan Addresses the Nation
description: President Reagan addresses the nation, postponing his planned State of the Union Address.

title: NASA Begins Investigation
description: NASA begins its investigation into the causes of the disaster.

title: Presidential Commission Established
description: President Reagan establishes a Presidential Commission to review the accident.

title: Presidential Commission Report
description: The Presidential Commission releases its report, citing a failure in the O-rings in the right solid rocket booster as the cause of the accident.

title: NASA Releases Report
description: NASA releases its report on the Challenger disaster, concurring with the findings of the Presidential Commission.

title: NASA Announces New Safety Measures
description: NASA announces that it will be implementing new safety measures and redesigning the solid rocket boosters.

title: Return to Flight
description: Space Shuttle Discovery launches, marking NASA's Return to Flight after the Challenger disaster.
